hints.content: Olivia's cheese has a mass of $\greenD{130}$ grams.
Sara brings a mass of $\maroonD{84}$ grams.

We can find the total mass of the cheese by adding the mass of the Olivia's cheese $(\greenD{130\text{ g}})$  to the mass of the Sara's cheese $(\maroonD{84\text{ g}})$.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle is labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket across the top rectangle is labeled Total mass. The bottom rectangle is divided into 2 parts. The longer left part is labeled 130 grams. The shorter right part is labeled 84 grams. A curved bracket across the longer left part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Olivia’s cheese. A curved bracket across the shorter right part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Sara’s cheese. !

hints.content: Olivia and Sara have $214$ grams of cheese.

question.content:
Olivia has a block of cheese (shown below). Sara came over and brought $84$ grams of cheese with her.

[[☃ image 1]]

**How many grams of cheese do Olivia and Sara have together?**  

[[☃ input-number 1]] grams

options.alt: A hanging scale weighing a block of cheese with a starting major tick mark of 0 grams and the additional 7 major tick marks labeled 20, 40, 60, 80, 100, 120, and 140. There is 1 minor unlabeled tick mark between every 2 major tick marks. The mass of the block of cheese on the scale is at the minor unlabeled tick mark after the major tick mark labeled 120. !
